member.name: T:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine
member.summary:
This abstract class encapsulates the core components of my robust string parsing algorithm, along with the code and data to support a set of commonly used delimiter and guard characters.
RobustDelimitedStringParser, a companion class defined in the same assembly, is a basic concrete instance of this class, which contains the bare essentials needed to expose its functionality to COM. The original class, Parser, extends RobustDelimitedStringParser with overloaded class constructors and Parse methods.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.BACK_QUOTE
member.summary:
Protect delimiters enclosed in backwards quotation marks, commonly called back-ticks.
The equivalent GuardChar member is BackQuote (2), and its integral value is 0x60 (96 decimal).

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.CARAT
member.summary:
Use this symbolic constant to construct a Parser instance that uses a carat ('^') as its delimiter, or to specify one to the static Parse method.
The equivalent DelimiterChar member is Carat (3), and its integral value is 0x5e (94 decimal).

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.CARRIAGE_RETURN
member.summary:
Use this symbolic constant to construct a Parser instance that uses a Carriage Return (CR) character as its delimiter, or to specify one to the static Parse method.
The equivalent DelimiterChar member is CarriageReturn (5), and its integral value is 0x0D (013 decimal).

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.COMMA
member.summary:
Use this symbolic constant to construct a Parser instance that uses a comma (',') as its delimiter, or to specify one to the static Parse method.
The equivalent DelimiterChar member is Comma (0), and its integral value is 0x2c (44 decimal).

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.DOUBLE_QUOTE
member.summary:
Protect delimiters enclosed in double quotation marks.
The equivalent GuardChar member is DoubleQuote (0), and its integral value is 0x22 (34 decimal).

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.LINE_FEED
member.summary:
Use this symbolic constant to construct a Parser instance that uses a Line Feed (LF) character as its delimiter, or to specify one to the static Parse method.
The equivalent DelimiterChar member is LineFeed (6), and its integral value is 0x0A (010 decimal).

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.SINGLE_QUOTE
member.summary:
Protect delimiters enclosed in single quotation marks.
The equivalent GuardChar member is SingleQuote (1), and its integral value is 0x27 (39 decimal).

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.SPACE
member.summary:
Use this symbolic constant to construct a Parser instance that uses a space (' ') as its delimiter, or to specify one to the static Parse method.
The equivalent DelimiterChar member is Space (4), and its integral value is 0x20 (32 decimal).

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.TAB
member.summary:
Use this symbolic constant to construct a Parser instance that uses a tab ('\t") as its delimiter, or to specify one to the static Parse method.
The equivalent DelimiterChar member is Tab (1), and its integral value is 9.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.VERTICAL_BAR
member.summary:
Use this symbolic constant to construct a Parser instance that uses a vertical bar ('|'), also known as the Pipe character, vertical slash, bar, obelisk, and various other names, as its delimiter, or to specify one to the static Parse method.
The equivalent DelimiterChar member is VerticalBar (2), and its integral value is 0x7C (124 decimal).

member.name: T:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.DelimiterChar
member.summary:
The DelimiterChar enumeration simplifies specifying any of the commonly used field delimiter characters.
All but the first and last values map to one of the public constants defined by this class.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.DelimiterChar.None
member.summary: This value indicates that the DelimiterChar is uninitialized.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.DelimiterChar.Carat
member.summary:
Specify a CARAT (^) as the delimiter.
The equivalent character constant is CARAT.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.DelimiterChar.CarriageReturn
member.summary:
Specify a Carriage Return (CR) control character as the delimiter.
The equivalent character constant is CARRIAGE_RETURN.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.DelimiterChar.Comma
member.summary:
Specify a comma as the delimiter.
The equivalent character constant is COMMA.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.DelimiterChar.LineFeed
member.summary:
Specify a Line Feed (LF) control character as the delimiter.
The equivalent character constant is LINE_FEED.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.DelimiterChar.Space
member.summary:
Specify a SPACE (' ') as the delimiter.
The equivalent character constant is SPACE.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.DelimiterChar.Tab
member.summary:
Specify a tab control character as the delimiter.
The equivalent character constant is TAB.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.DelimiterChar.VerticalBar
member.summary:
Specify a vertical bar ('|'), commonly called the pipe symbol, as the delimiter.
The equivalent character constant is VERTICAL_BAR.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.DelimiterChar.Other
member.summary:
Infrastructure: The delimiter is something besides the enumerated choices.
You cannot specify this type as input to the constructor. Use the overload that takes a character.

member.name: T:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.GuardChar
member.summary:
The GuardChar enumeration simplifies specifying any of the commonly used field delimiter protector characters.
All but the first and last values map to one of the public constants defined by this class.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.GuardChar.None
member.summary: This value indicates that the GuardChar is uninitialized.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.GuardChar.BackQuote
member.summary:
Specify a double quotation as the protector of delimiters.
The equivalent character constant is SINGLE_QUOTE.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.GuardChar.DoubleQuote
member.summary:
Specify a double quotation as the protector of delimiters.
The equivalent character constant is DOUBLE_QUOTE.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.GuardChar.SingleQuote
member.summary:
Specify a double quotation as the protector of delimiters.
The equivalent character constant is SINGLE_QUOTE.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.GuardChar.Other
member.summary:
Infrastructure: The delimiter is something besides the enumerated choices.
You cannot specify this type as input to the constructor. Use the overload that takes a character.

member.name: T:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.GuardDisposition
member.summary: Indicate whether to keep or discard field guard characters. Guards that simply appear in the body of a field are always preserved.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.GuardDisposition.Keep
member.summary: Keep guards that surround a whole field.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.GuardDisposition.Strip
member.summary: Strip (discard) guards that surround a whole field.

member.name: T:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.LockMethod
member.summary: Once locked, this flag tracks whether the lock was applied by an explicit call to LockSettings or by an internal call made on the first call to the Parse method. Until then, its value is IsUnlocked, which reflects the uninitialized state of its instance member.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.LockMethod.IsUnlocked
member.summary: The properties are unlocked, which is their initial state, even when the constructor sets one or more of them.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.LockMethod.LockedExplicitly
member.summary: The LockSettings method was called explicitly by the code that called this instance into existence.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.LockMethod.LockedImplicitly
member.summary: The LockSettings method was called by the Parse method.

member.name: T:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.LockState
member.summary: This flag tracks the lock state of the instance properties that govern operation of the CSV parsing engine when the instance method calls upon it to parse a string.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.LockState.Unlocked
member.summary: Initially, the operating parameters are unlocked.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.LockState.Locked
member.summary:
When the object is locked, either explicitly by calling the LockSettings method on the instance, or implicitly, the first time that an instance Parse method is called, whichever comes first, a private LockState member transitions to this state.
Thereafter, it is an error to change any property, and any attempt to do so elicits an InvalidOperationException exception.

member.name: T:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.TrimWhiteSpace
member.summary: Indicate whether to trim leading and trailing space from fields. By default, leading and trailing white space is left. The other three options are self explanatory.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.TrimWhiteSpace.Leave
member.summary: Leave leading and trailing white space. Assume that its presence is meaningful. This is the default behavior.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.TrimWhiteSpace.TrimLeading
member.summary: Trim leading white space. This is designed specifically for use with Issuer and Subject fields of X.509 digital certificates.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.TrimWhiteSpace.TrimTrailing
member.summary: Trim trailing white space. This option is especially useful with CSV files generated by Microsoft Excel, which often have long runs of meaningless white space, especially when a worksheet has blank rows or columns in its UsedRange.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.TrimWhiteSpace.TrimBoth
member.summary:
Given that TrimLeading and TrimTrailing are required use cases, trimming both ends is essentially free.
This flag is implemented such that it can be logically processed as TrimLeading | TrimTrailing.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.DEFAULT_DELIMITER
member.summary: This property governs the static Parse methods that omit a delimiter argument.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.DEFAULT_DELIMITER_GUARD
member.summary: This constant governs the static Parse methods that omit a delimiter protector (guard) character.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.DEFAULT_GUARD_DISPOSITION
member.summary: This constant governs the static Parse methods that leave the disposition of guard characters unspecified.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.DEFAULT_WHITESPACE_TREATMENT
member.summary: This constant governs the static Parse methods that leave the treatment of white space unspecified. The default is the most conservative treatment.

member.name: T:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.GuardState
member.summary: Specify whether and why the current character is guarded.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.GuardState.Unguarded
member.summary: The current character is unguarded.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.GuardState.FieldIsGuarded
member.summary: The current character belongs to a guarded field.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.GuardState.SegmentIsGuarded
member.summary: The current character belongs to a guarded segment of a field.

member.name: T:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.DelimiterMap
member.summary: An element of an array of these structures identifies the delimiter character, the corresponding member of the DelimiterChar enumeration, and a string representation to display on reports and in debugger windows.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.DelimiterMap.DelimiterEnum
member.summary: The DelimiterChar enumeration does double duty, both as an index for the array of these structures that defines preset delimiter characters, and as a convenient mechanism for using unambiguous numeric constants as inputs to the parsing engine.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.DelimiterMap.DelimiterCharacter
member.summary: This member stores a preset character, to simplify using several popular field delimiter characters, most of which are tricky to define correctly in code.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.DelimiterMap.DelimiterDisplay
member.summary: This member stores a preset string, constructed from a template, that displays the character, itself, or a literal proxy, along with decimal and hexadecimal representations of its numeric value.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.DelimiterMap.#ctor(WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.DelimiterChar,System.Char,System.String)
member.summary: The purpose of this constructor is to permit the array of preset delimiters to be constructed at compile time.
member.param: Specify the DelimiterChar member to store into the DelimiterEnum member.
Specify the character to store into the DelimiterCharacter member.
Specify the string to store into the DelimiterDisplay member.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.DelimiterMap.ToString
member.summary: Take control of the string representation of this structure.
member.returns: Use the DelimiterDisplay member as the string representation.
member.remarks: The default string representation of a user defined type is its absolute (fully qualified) type name, which isn't much use in a debugger windows, since such a rendering duplicates information that appears in the last column anyway. On the other hand, a labeled display of the properties means that the value shown in the debug window is immediately useful, and expanding the member list is unnecessary.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.DelimiterMap.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Take control of the IEquatable interface implementation of this structure.
member.param: Specify the other GuardMap structure against which to compare this structure.
member.returns: Equality is evaluated based on the values of the GuardEnum and GuardCharacter members of each structure.
member.remarks: Taking control of the IEquatable implementation partially paves the way for sorting the list in a meaningful fashion. Though it is probably overkill, it's ready if needed for some future extension.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.DelimiterMap.GetHashCode
member.summary: Since I overrode the Equals method, the compiler insists that I must also override GetHashCode. That being the case, I'll accept the default method generated by the compiler.

member.name: T:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.GuardMap
member.summary: An element of an array of these structures identifies the delimiter guard character, the corresponding member of the GuardChar enumeration, and a string representation to display on reports and in debugger windows.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.GuardMap.GuardEnum
member.summary: The GuardChar enumeration does double duty, both as an index for the array of these structures that defines preset delimiter guard characters, and as a convenient mechanism for using unambiguous numeric constants as inputs to the parsing engine.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.GuardMap.GuardCharacter
member.summary: This member stores a preset character, to simplify using several popular field delimiter guard characters, most of which are tricky to define correctly in code.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.GuardMap.GuardDisplay
member.summary: This member stores a preset string, constructed from a template, that displays the character, itself, or a literal proxy, along with decimal and hexadecimal representations of its numeric value.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.GuardMap.ToString
member.summary: Take control of the string representation of this structure.
member.returns: Use the GuardDisplay member as the string representation.
member.remarks: The default string representation of a user defined type is its absolute (fully qualified) type name, which isn't much use in a debugger windows, since such a rendering duplicates information that appears in the last column anyway. On the other hand, a labeled display of the properties means that the value shown in the debug window is immediately useful, and expanding the member list is unnecessary.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.GuardMap.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Take control of the IEquatable interface implementation of this structure.
member.param: Specify the other GuardMap structure against which to compare this structure.
member.returns: Equality is evaluated based on the values of the GuardEnum and GuardCharacter members of each structure.
member.remarks: Taking control of the IEquatable implementation partially paves the way for sorting the list in a meaningful fashion. Though it is probably overkill, it's ready if needed for some future extension.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.GuardMap.GetHashCode
member.summary: Since I overrode the Equals method, the compiler insists that I must also override GetHashCode. That being the case, I'll accept the default method generated by the compiler.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.s_aDelimiterMap
member.summary: This array stores information about the preset delimiter characters, ordered by the integral value to which their DelimiterChar members resolve.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.s_aGuardrMap
member.summary: This array stores information about the preset delimiter guard characters, ordered by the integral value to which their GuardChar members resolve.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine._chrDelimiter
member.summary: Instance storage for the delimiter character is marked as protected, so that derived classes can access it directly, rather than wasting stack space and processor time to go through its public property.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine._chrGuard
member.summary: Instance storage for the delimiter guard character is marked as protected, so that derived classes can access it directly, rather than wasting stack space and processor time to go through its public property.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine._enmDelimiter
member.summary: Instance storage for the delimiter character enumeration is marked as protected, so that derived classes can access it directly, rather than wasting stack space and processor time to go through its public property.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine._enmGuard
member.summary: Instance storage for the delimiter guard character enumeration is marked as protected, so that derived classes can access it directly, rather than wasting stack space and processor time to go through its public property.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine._enmGuardDisposition
member.summary: Instance storage for the delimiter guard character enumeration is marked as protected, so that derived classes can access it directly, rather than wasting stack space and processor time to go through its public property.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine._enmLockMethod
member.summary: This flag maintains the method by which the class property values became locked.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine._fSettingsLocked
member.summary: Instance storage for the settings lock state enumeration is marked as protected, so that derived classes can access it directly, rather than wasting stack space and processor time to go through its public property.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine._objSettingsLockSync
member.summary: Use this object to synchronize access by multiple threads. The only case in which this seems necessary is when the properties are edited or locked.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine._objParseingLockSync
member.summary: Use this object to synchronize access to the Parse method by multiple threads.
member.remarks: The parse method uses this lock only very briefly while the settings lock is evaluated and set if it isn't already.

member.name: F:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine._enmTrimWhiteSpace
member.summary: Instance storage for the white space disposition enumeration is marked as protected, so that derived classes can access it directly, rather than wasting stack space and processor time to go through its public property.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.#ctor
member.summary: The default constructor creates a Parser that uses its namesake, the comma, as its delimiter, protects commas that occur within double quotation marks, discards double quotation marks that surround whole fields, and preserves leading and trailing white space.

member.name: P:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.FieldDelimiter
member.summary:
Get or set the character currently specified as the delimiter character.
Before a value is accepted, it is compared against the current delimiter guard character. If the two characters are different, the new value is accepted and saved. Otherwise, an InvalidOperationException exception is thrown.
To ensure consistent behavior in a loop, once the LockSettings or Parse method on an instance is called, the property values are fixed permanently (for the remaining lifetime of the instance).
member.remarks: The setter method is thread-safe.

member.name: P:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.DelimiterGuard
member.summary:
Get or set the character currently specified as the delimiter guard character.
Before a value is accepted, it is compared against the current delimiter character. If the two characters are different, the new value is accepted and saved. Otherwise, an InvalidOperationException exception is thrown.
To ensure consistent behavior in a loop, once the LockSettings or Parse method on an instance is called, the property values are fixed permanently (for the remaining lifetime of the instance).
member.remarks: The setter method is thread-safe.

member.name: P:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.GuardCharDisposition
member.summary:
Get or set the flag implemented by the GuardDisposition enumeration that indicates whether delimiter guard characters surrounding a whole filed are discarded (default) or kept.
To ensure consistent behavior in a loop, once the LockSettings or Parse method on an instance is called, the property values are fixed permanently (for the remaining lifetime of the instance).
member.remarks: The setter method is thread-safe.

member.name: P:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.SettingsLockMethod
member.summary: This read only flag indicates the event that caused the other settings to become locked.

member.name: P:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.SettingsLocked
member.summary:
This read only flag indicates whether the other settings are locked, and cannot henceforth be changed, for the remaining lifetime of the instance.
There are two ways for settings to become locked.
1) Call the instance Parse method.
2) Call the LockSettings method.
member.remarks: Since access to this property is synchronized, its value reflects the most recent change made by code running on another thread.

member.name: P:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.WhiteSpaceDisposition
member.summary:
Get or set the flag implemented by the TrimWhiteSpace enumeration that indicates whether leading and trailing white space is kept (default) or discarded if at the beginning, end, or both.
To ensure consistent behavior in a loop, once the LockSettings or Parse method on an instance is called, the property values are fixed permanently (for the remaining lifetime of the instance).
member.remarks: The setter method is thread-safe.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.LockSettings
member.summary:
Lock the properties against changes.
IMPORTANT: Once this method is called on an instance, subsequent attempts to set any of its properties are punished, without a trial, by an InvalidOperationException exception.
member.remarks:
The fact that there is no inverse (unlock) method is by design, to ensure that a series of calls to parse all records in a file use the same settings.
This method is manifestly thread-safe.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Use the properties set on the current Parser instance to parse any valid CSV string.
member.param: The string may be any type of well formed CSV string. See Remarks on the like named static method.
member.returns: The return value is the array of fields parsed from the string.
member.remarks: This method is thread-safe.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.Parse(System.String,System.Char,System.Char,WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.GuardDisposition,WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.TrimWhiteSpace)
member.summary: Call this method to parse any CSV string without working from an instance of the Parser class, specifying both the field delimiter and a separate character to protect delimiters embedded in fields.
member.param: The string may be any type of well formed CSV string. See Remarks.
Specify the character to treat as the delimiter. Any character that can occur in a text file is valid.
Specify the character to treat as the protector of delimiters. Any character that can occur in a text file is valid.
Specify whether guard characters that surround a whole field should be stripped (default) or kept.
Specify whether leading or trailing white space should be trimmed from a field.
member.returns: The return value is the array of fields parsed from the string.
member.remarks: Rather than wastefully coding the same routine twice, parsing for both instances of the Parser class and stand-alone parse requests that accept defaults for one or both of the character parameters is handled by this static method. This is easily accomplished by having the instance method pass in its current property values, along with the string, which always accompanies the request.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.Parse(System.String,System.Char,System.Char,WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.GuardDisposition)
member.summary: Call this method to parse any CSV string without working from an instance of the Parser class, specifying both the field delimiter and a separate character to protect delimiters embedded in fields.
member.param: The string may be any type of well formed CSV string. See Remarks.
Specify the character to treat as the delimiter. Any character that can occur in a text file is valid.
Specify the character to treat as the protector of delimiters. Any character that can occur in a text file is valid.
Specify whether guard characters that surround a whole field should be stripped (default) or kept.
member.returns: The return value is the array of fields parsed from the string.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.Parse(System.String,System.Char,System.Char)
member.summary: Call this method to parse any CSV string without working from an instance of the Parser class, specifying both the field delimiter and a separate character to protect delimiters embedded in fields.
member.param: The string may be any type of well formed CSV string. See Remarks.
Specify the character to treat as the delimiter. Any character that can occur in a text file is valid.
Specify the character to treat as the protector of delimiters. Any character that can occur in a text file is valid.
member.returns: The return value is the array of fields parsed from the string.
member.remarks: Rather than wastefully coding the same routine twice, parsing for both instances of the Parser class and stand-alone parse requests that accept defaults for one or both of the character parameters is handled by this static method. This is easily accomplished by having the instance method pass in its current property values, along with the string, which always accompanies the request.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.Parse(System.String,System.Char)
member.summary: Call this method to parse any CSV string without working from an instance of the Parser class, specifying the field delimiter, and using the default delimiter guard character, the double quotation mark.
member.param: The string may be any type of well formed CSV string. See Remarks.
Specify the character to treat as the delimiter. Any character that can occur in a text file is valid.
member.returns: The return value is the array of fields parsed from the string.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.StandardCSVParse(System.String)
member.summary: Call this method to parse any CSV string without working from an instance of the Parser class, using the default delimiter character and the default delimiter guard character, the double quotation mark. See Remarks.
member.param: The string may be any type of well formed CSV string. See Remarks.
member.returns: The return value is the array of fields parsed from the string.
member.remarks: This method gets its own name, to distinguish it from a similarly named instance method that has the same signature. This is just as well, because its distinctive name clarifies that its use is limited to true Comma Separated Values (CSV) strings.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.DelimiterCharFromEnum(WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.DelimiterChar)
member.summary: The inverse of DelimiterEnumFromChar, this method returns the character that corresponds to the specified member of the DelimiterChar enumeration, unless the specified DelimiterChar is not that of one of the presets.
member.param: Specify the DelimiterChar member to be mapped to the corresponding delimiter character. This routine treats DelimiterChar.None and DelimiterChar.Other as invalid values, and raises an InvalidEnumArgumentException Exception, as it does if its value is outright invalid (out of range).
member.returns: The return value is the character that corresponds to the specified DelimiterChar enumeration member.
member.exception: An InvalidEnumArgumentException exception is thrown if the specified DelimiterChar value is either out of range, or is either of DelimiterChar.None or DelimiterChar.None.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.FormatInvalidCastExceptionMessage(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: The Equals methods on the two structures, DelimiterMap and GuardMap, use this static method to format a detailed exception report when either is called to compare an instance with an object of the wrong type.
member.param: This argument is the instance on which the Equals method was called.
This argument is the instance against which a comparison was requested. This method is called when the System.Type of pobjOther differs from that of pobjThis.
member.returns: The return value is a string that endeavors to provide the person who is tasked with investigating the exception with enough data to identify and correct its cause.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.GuardCharFromEnum(WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.GuardChar)
member.summary: The inverse of GuardEnumFromChar, this method returns the character that corresponds to the specified member of the GuardChar enumeration, unless the specified GuardChar is not that of one of the presets.
member.param: Specify the GuardMap member to be mapped to the corresponding guard character. This routine treats GuardMap.None and GuardMap.Other as invalid values, and raises an InvalidEnumArgumentException Exception, as it does if its value is outright invalid (out of range).
member.returns: The return value is the character that corresponds to the specified GuardChar enumeration member.
member.exception: An InvalidEnumArgumentException exception is thrown if the specified GuardChar value is either out of range, or is either of GuardChar.None or GuardChar.None.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.DelimiterEnumFromChar(System.Char)
member.summary: Return the DelimiterChar enumeration member that corresponds to a given character, if it is one of the presets.
member.param: Specify the character to be mapped onto the DelimiterChar enumeration.
member.returns: If the pchrDelimiter argument is one of the preset characters, the return value is the corresponding member of the DelimiterChar enumeration. Otherwise, DelimiterChar.Other, the highest value in the enumeration, is returned.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.GuardEnumFromChar(System.Char)
member.summary: Return the GuardChar enumeration member that corresponds to a given character, if it is one of the presets.
member.param: Specify the character to be mapped onto the GuardChar enumeration.
member.returns: If the pchrProtector argument is one of the preset characters, the return value is the corresponding member of the GuardChar enumeration. Otherwise, GuardChar.Other, the highest value in the enumeration, is returned.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.ShowDelimiterAndGuardChars(System.Char,System.Char)
member.summary: Format a message that unambiguously describes the delimiter and guard characters specified for an instance.
member.param: Specify the selected delimiter character.
Specify the selected guard character.
member.returns: The return value is a message string that fully describes the guard and delimiter characters, including both decimal and hexadecimal representations of their numeric values.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.TransformAsDirectoed(System.Text.StringBuilder,System.Char,WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.GuardDisposition,WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.TrimWhiteSpace)
member.summary: Other methods on the base class and its derived classes, usually working through a base class method, invoke this routine to put the finishing touches on a parsed substring, which may consist of trimming its guard characters, if present, trimming leading and/or trailing white space, or neither.
member.param: This string is the raw substring returned by the parsing engine.
This character is the guard character that protects delimiter characters that are to be ignored.
This flag specifies whether guard characters, if present, should be striped or left.
This flag specifies whether to trim or leave leading and/or trailing white space.
member.returns: A copy of the string, with guard characters, leading white space, and trailing white space removed if so directed.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.TransformWhiteSpace(System.String,WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.TrimWhiteSpace)
member.summary: The companion TransformAsDirectoed method calls upon this method as needed to trim leading and/or trailing white space, depending upon the state of the TrimWhiteSpace flag.
member.param: This string is the input that was fed to TransformAsDirectoed, with guard characters, if any, stripped from both ends.
The TrimWhiteSpace flag is passed through from TransformAsDirectoed, and it determines the action taken by this routine.
member.returns: The returned string is handed up through TransformAsDirectoed, since it is ready to return to the caller following this transformation.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Overriding the Equals method permits meaningful equality comparisons of CSVParseEngine instances.
member.param: To be valid, the other object must be a CSVParseEngine object or a derivative thereof. Otherwise, an InvalidCastException exception is thrown.
member.returns: If all four public properties other than the locked state are equal, two CSVParseEngine instances are evaluated as equal to each other. Otherwise, they are evaluates as unequal.
member.exception: Attempting to evaluate the equality of a CSVParseEngine against an object of another type raises an InvalidCastException exception, which reports the fully qualified types of both comparands, along with a string representation of each (whatever their respective ToString methods return).

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.GetHashCode
member.summary: Return the hash code of a string composed of a concatenation of the string representations of the key properties of the instance.
member.returns: The return value is the hash code generated from a comma-separated list of the properties of the instance.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.ToString
member.summary: Return a message that displays the state of the properties that govern the behavior of the Parse method.
member.returns: The returned string makes all properties visible in debugger windows without expanding the properties, and provides a quick way to list them on a report.

member.name: P:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.ICSVParser.FieldDelimiter
member.summary:
Get or set the character currently specified as the delimiter character.
Before a value is accepted, it is compared against the current delimiter guard character. If the two characters are different, the new value is accepted and saved. Otherwise, an InvalidOperationException exception is thrown.
To ensure consistent behavior in a loop, once the LockSettings or Parse method on an instance is called, the property values are fixed permanently (for the remaining lifetime of the instance).
member.remarks: The setter method is thread-safe.

member.name: P:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.ICSVParser.DelimiterGuard
member.summary:
Get or set the character currently specified as the delimiter guard character.
Before a value is accepted, it is compared against the current delimiter character. If the two characters are different, the new value is accepted and saved. Otherwise, an InvalidOperationException exception is thrown.
To ensure consistent behavior in a loop, once the LockSettings or Parse method on an instance is called, the property values are fixed permanently (for the remaining lifetime of the instance).
member.remarks: The setter method is thread-safe.

member.name: P:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.ICSVParser.GuardCharDisposition
member.summary:
Get or set the flag implemented by the GuardDisposition enumeration that indicates whether delimiter guard characters surrounding a whole filed are discarded (default) or kept.
To ensure consistent behavior in a loop, once the LockSettings or Parse method on an instance is called, the property values are fixed permanently (for the remaining lifetime of the instance).
member.remarks: The setter method is thread-safe.

member.name: P:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.ICSVParser.WhiteSpaceDisposition
member.summary:
Get or set the flag implemented by the TrimWhiteSpace enumeration that indicates whether leading and trailing white space is kept (default) or discarded if at the beginning, end, or both.
To ensure consistent behavior in a loop, once the LockSettings or Parse method on an instance is called, the property values are fixed permanently (for the remaining lifetime of the instance).
member.remarks: The setter method is thread-safe.

member.name: P:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.ICSVParser.SettingsLocked
member.summary:
This read only flag indicates whether the other settings are locked, and cannot henceforth be changed, for the remaining lifetime of the instance.
There are two ways for settings to become locked.
1) Call the instance Parse method.
2) Call the LockSettings method.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.ICSVParser.LockSettings
member.summary:
Lock the properties against changes.
IMPORTANT: Once this method is called on an instance, subsequent attempts to set any of its properties are punished, without a trial, by an InvalidOperationException exception.
member.remarks:
The fact that there is no inverse (unlock) method is by design, to ensure that a series of calls to parse all records in a file use the same settings.
This method is manifestly thread-safe.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.ICSVParser.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Use the properties set on the current Parser instance to parse any valid CSV string.
member.param: The string may be any type of well formed CSV string. See Remarks on the like named static method.
member.returns: The return value is the array of fields parsed from the string.
member.remarks: This method is thread-safe.

member.name: T:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.Parser
member.summary:
This class defines the most robust CSV string parser that I can conceive, based on 17 years of experience writing CSV parsers, leading to the discovery today of a use case that breaks parsers that were thought to be bulletproof.
Like its parent, RobustDelimitedStringParser, this class relies upon a static method on its base class, CSVParseEngine, to do the work.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.Parser.#ctor
member.summary: The default constructor creates a Parser that uses its namesake, the comma, as its delimiter, protects commas that occur within double quotation marks, discards double quotation marks that surround whole fields, and preserves leading and trailing white space.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.Parser.#ctor(System.Char)
member.summary: Use this constructor to override the default delimiter (comma) by passing your own character.
member.param: Specify the character to treat as the delimiter. Any character that can occur in a text file is valid.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.Parser.#ctor(WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.DelimiterChar)
member.summary: Use this constructor to override the default delimiter (comma) by selecting a character from an enumeration.
member.param: Use any member of the DelimiterChar enumeration except DelimiterChar.Other to specify your chosen delimiter.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.Parser.#ctor(WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.GuardChar)
member.summary: Use this constructor to override the default protector of delimiters (double quote) by selecting a character from an enumeration.
member.param: Use any member of the GuardChar enumeration except GuardChar.Other to specify your chosen character to protect delimiters.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.Parser.#ctor(System.Char,System.Char)
member.summary: Use this constructor to override the default delimiter (comma) and the protector of delimiters by passing your own character for each. See Remarks.
member.param: Specify the character to treat as the delimiter. Any character that can occur in a text file is valid.
Specify the character to treat as the protector of delimiters. Any character that can occur in a text file is valid.
member.remarks: Since both delimiters are of the same type, this constructor is the only avenue to specify a nonstandard delimiter AND a nonstandard protector. (It could be done, but not without fabricated types.) For most applications, the enumerated types are adequate, and safer.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.Parser.#ctor(WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.DelimiterChar,WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.GuardChar)
member.summary: Use this constructor to override the default delimiter (comma) and the protector of delimiters (double quotation marks) by selecting characters from a pair of enumerations that offer two mutually exclusive lists of characters.
member.param: Use any member of the DelimiterChar enumeration except DelimiterChar.Other to specify your chosen delimiter.
Use any member of the GuardChar enumeration except GuardChar.Other to specify your chosen character to protect delimiters.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.Parser.#ctor(WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.DelimiterChar,WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.GuardChar,WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.GuardDisposition)
member.summary:
Use this constructor to override the default delimiter (comma) and the protector of delimiters (double quotation marks) by selecting characters from a pair of enumerations that offer two mutually exclusive lists of characters.
In addition, this constructor can override the default disposition of guard characters that surround a whole field. By default, these guard characters are stripped; this constructor allows you to keep them.
member.param: Use any member of the DelimiterChar enumeration except DelimiterChar.Other to specify your chosen delimiter.
Use any member of the GuardChar enumeration except GuardChar.Other to specify your chosen character to protect delimiters.
Specify whether guard characters that surround a whole field should be stripped (default) or kept.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.Parser.#ctor(WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.DelimiterChar,WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.GuardChar,WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.TrimWhiteSpace)
member.summary:
Use this constructor to override the default delimiter (comma) and the protector of delimiters (double quotation marks) by selecting characters from a pair of enumerations that offer two mutually exclusive lists of characters.
In addition, this constructor can override the default disposition of guard characters that surround a whole field. By default, these guard characters are stripped; this constructor allows you to keep them.
member.param: Use any member of the DelimiterChar enumeration except DelimiterChar.Other to specify your chosen delimiter.
Use any member of the GuardChar enumeration except GuardChar.Other to specify your chosen character to protect delimiters.
Specify whether leading or trailing white space should be trimmed from a field.

member.name: M:WizardWrx.AnyCSV.Parser.#ctor(WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.DelimiterChar,WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.GuardChar,WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.GuardDisposition,WizardWrx.AnyCSV.CSVParseEngine.TrimWhiteSpace)
member.summary:
Use this constructor to override the default delimiter (comma) and the protector of delimiters (double quotation marks) by selecting characters from a pair of enumerations that offer two mutually exclusive lists of characters.
In addition, this constructor can override the default disposition of guard characters that surround a whole field. By default, these guard characters are stripped; this constructor allows you to keep them.
member.param: Use any member of the DelimiterChar enumeration except DelimiterChar.Other to specify your chosen delimiter.
Use any member of the GuardChar enumeration except GuardChar.Other to specify your chosen character to protect delimiters.
Specify whether guard characters that surround a whole field should be stripped (default) or kept.
Specify whether leading or trailing white space should be trimmed from a field.

member.name: T:WizardWrx.Properties.Resources
member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.name: P:WizardWrx.Properties.Resources.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:WizardWrx.Properties.Resources.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: P:WizardWrx.Properties.Resources.DLM_DSP_CARAT
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Carat (^, ASCII code 0x5E).

member.name: P:WizardWrx.Properties.Resources.DLM_DSP_CARRIAGE_RETURN
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Carriage return (CR, ASCII code 0x0D).

member.name: P:WizardWrx.Properties.Resources.DLM_DSP_COMMA
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Comma (, ASCII code 0x2C).

member.name: P:WizardWrx.Properties.Resources.DLM_DSP_LINE_FEED
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Line feed (LF, ASCII code 0x0A).

member.name: P:WizardWrx.Properties.Resources.DLM_DSP_OTHER
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Other ({0}, ASCII code {1}).

member.name: P:WizardWrx.Properties.Resources.DLM_DSP_SPACE
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Space (ASCII code 0x20).

member.name: P:WizardWrx.Properties.Resources.DLM_DSP_TAB
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Tab (Horizontal Tab, ASCII code 0x09).

member.name: P:WizardWrx.Properties.Resources.DLM_DSP_VERTICAL_BAR
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Vertical Bar (|, a. k. a. Pipe, ASCII code 0x7C).

member.name: P:WizardWrx.Properties.Resources.ERRMSG_SAME_CHAR_AS_DLM_AND_GUARD
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The delimiter and guard characters must differ.{2} Specified Delimiter Character = {0}{2} Specified Guard Character = {1}.

member.name: P:WizardWrx.Properties.Resources.ERRMSG_SETTINGS_ARE_LOCKED
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Settings on this instance are locked..

member.name: P:WizardWrx.Properties.Resources.ERRMSG_TYPE_MISMATCH
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to {0} is of type {1}, which cannot be meaningfully compared to a {2}, which is of type {3}..

member.name: P:WizardWrx.Properties.Resources.GRD_DSP_BACK_QUOTE
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Back Quotation Mark (`, ASCII code 0x60).

member.name: P:WizardWrx.Properties.Resources.GRD_DSP_DOUBLE_QUOTE
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Double Quotation Mark (", ASCII code 0x22).

member.name: P:WizardWrx.Properties.Resources.TOSTRING_TEMPLATE
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Delimiter = {0}{6}Guard Character = {1}{6}Trim White Space = {2}{6}Guard Disposition = {3}{6}Lock State = {4}{6}Lock Method = {5}{6}.
